issues.title: [Bug]: During local embeddingï¼ŒRAGFlow is sending too much text at once, exceeding the model's maximum token limit, causing the model to be unable to fully read the input.
issues.body:
### Is there an existing issue for the same bug?

- [x] I have checked the existing issues.

### RAGFlow workspace code commit ID

main

### RAGFlow image version

v0.15.1,nightly

### Other environment information

```Markdown

```

### Actual behavior

When employing embedding models with a lower 'maximum input token' capacityï¼Œmodels such as bge-large and conan-embedding-v1 are limited to a maximum input of 512 tokens. When using these models for embedding, RAGFlow sends more than 512 tokens at once, ollama will encounter an error.
I've found the cause of the error hereï¼š[https://github.com/ollama/ollama/issues/7288#issuecomment-2591709109](url)
Although I can adjust the maximum input limit of the model in ollama, it will cause RAGFlow's text to be truncated, resulting in incomplete embeddings.Additionally, I'm unable to locate a setting within RAGFlow to control the maximum input for the embedding model.

When adding a model, the max token setting controls the maximum output, not the input, which doesn't apply to embedding models.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c7776696-0ef2-432d-95af-a9dccd155705)

The same issue of an ineffective max token option also exists when adding reranker models.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8e2a4b78-36d5-4714-88e4-e1759f4feb00)



### Expected behavior

Please add a setting to RAGFlow to control the maximum number of tokens sent to the embedding model per request, and also fix the bug where the max token limit is ineffective when adding reranker models.

### Steps to reproduce

```Markdown
Using the bge-large:latest model in ollama, if the embedding is performed with a method other than 'general' (I am using 'book'), and the token count goes over 512, an error occurs and the embedding is terminated.
```

### Additional information

_No response_

But it will not slice text apart from the middle of text to ruin the semantics, which is meaningless to embedding.

issues.title: [Feature Request]: Agent supports global memory
issues.body:
### Is there an existing issue for the same feature request?

- [x] I have checked the existing issues.

### Is your feature request related to a problem?

```Markdown
If Agent uses the Category node, it will sometimes divide the user's questions into different categories, but in fact, the two problems are contextual. For example, the first question requires agent to recommend a product. After interacting with llm, llm prompts you to need more information, such as the usage scenario of the product. At this time, if I directly reply to the use scenario name, Category will divide the scene name and the first question "recommend a product" into two categories. Then the agent will follow different flow branches and make memory switching, which is different from the previous tag.
```

### Describe the feature you'd like

We can consider adding the global agent memory to support better problem classification, question answer and other scenario performance, and avoid the context conversion problems caused by the switching branch caused by Category. Agents should always behave like the same person for a session, instead of looking like schizophrenic now.

### Describe implementation you've considered

_No response_

### Documentation, adoption, use case

```Markdown
- Add the global agent memory 
```

### Additional information

_No response_

issues.title: [Bug]: Search Result Reference Links Not Working
issues.body:
### Self Checks

- [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues), including closed ones.
- [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Non-english title submitions will be closed directly ( éè‹±æ–‡æ ‡é¢˜çš„æäº¤å°†ä¼šè¢«ç›´æ¥å…³é—­ ) ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields.

### RAGFlow workspace code commit ID

none

### RAGFlow image version

none

### Other environment information

```Markdown

```

### Actual behavior

When clicking on reference links in search results, the document viewer fails to load the original document content. The links appear to be clickable but result in file loading errors.
1. User performs a search and gets results with reference links
2. Clicking on a reference link to view the original document
3. Document viewer fails to load the content
4. User sees an error instead of the document content

### Expected behavior

1. User performs a search and gets results with reference links
2. Clicking on a reference link should:
   - Open the document viewer
   - Load the original document content
   - Display the document in the appropriate viewer (PDF, Word, etc.)
   - Show the correct section of the document where the reference was found

### Steps to reproduce

```Markdown
1. Perform a search in the application
2. Find a search result with a reference link
3. Click on the reference link
4. Observe that the document viewer fails to load the content
5. Checking browser developer tools has found: SyntaxError: Unexpected token 'd', "data":{"cod" ... is not valid JSON. in logic-hooks.ts, line 236.
```

### Additional information

_No response_

comments.author: dosubot[bot]
comments.body:
<!-- Answer -->
There are a few known causes for reference links in RAGFlow search results not working. First, make sure your Dialog configuration has the do_refer field set to 1â€”this is required for reference links to function properly. If the referenced document has been moved or deleted from the

issues.author: neal-davis

comments.author: dosubot[bot]
comments.body:
<!-- Answer -->
Your Docker build error is likely related to connectivity issues with the PyPI mirror set by the `NEED_MIRROR=1` argument. This can cause failures if the mirror is down or unreachable from your environment. To troubleshoot:

- Try building with `NEED_MIRROR=0` to use the default PyPI

issues.title: [Feature Request] Backup/Export and Restore/Import of KnowledgeBase and Agents.
issues.body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/orgs/infiniflow/discussions/3163
Originally posted by **sbmandava** November 2, 2024 Requirement : Ability to Backup/Export and Restore/Import Agent Workflows or Share Workflows on a new system. Why ? - Allows us to do Version Control on the Flow Changes. (Right now anything can be changed) - Seperate Development from Production Usage. So we can tweak workflows in Dev Environment Test, Verify and then export it Production and reconnect it to production Knowledge Bases. - Backup and Restore Method of these specific components : KnowledgeBase and Agents (so they can redeploy on new system and make minor tweaks to get it production ready)
issues.author: KevinHuSh

comments.author: HugoChaan
comments.body: This is a very important feature. I hope you can put it on the agenda as soon as possible!ğŸ™ğŸ™ğŸ™

comments.author: ZhenhangTung
comments.body: Also related: https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/7269

comments.author: ZhenhangTung
comments.body: @HugoChaan Why is it very important to you and your team? Can you explain more to us so we can better understand your use cases to help us prioritizing features.

comments.author: joergkoch
comments.body:
It is also important for us, uses cases are:

- automatic deployment process / pipeline from test to production
- manaual exchange agents between developers or different environments
- Secure business continuity: Export and backup agents for desaster recovery situations

comments.author: ZhenhangTung
comments.body: @joergkoch Thanks for the sharing. Is there any use case for the knowledge base module in your company?

comments.author: voycey
comments.body:
For those having this same issue on Mac since 15.2 upgrade:

1. install macports
2. `/opt/local/bin/port search pyicu` and install the one matching the python version you used with uv
3. remove xcode and re-install
4. rerun `uv sync`

...

```Markdown
I am working on an AWS virtual enviroment using ragflow via containers.
```

When an already started to parse knowledge base is deleted and the parsing is not fully completed, the next documents you start to parse will be queued, assuming you have parse tasks left, even if you already deleted the knowledge base. My solution to this has been to restart my machine, but this has to be fixed. 

### Expected behavior

_No response_

### Steps to reproduce

```Markdown
Start parsing documents in a knowledge base and delete it when some documents are still parsing, then create a new one and when you try to parse the new documents they will be queued.
```

### Additional information

_No response_

### Is your feature request related to a problem?


As https://ragflow.io/docs/dev/begin_component says,

> If your agent's Begin component takes a variable, you cannot embed it into a webpage.

But for a translation agent, the Begin component needs to take the variable like uploaded file, so it can't be into a webpage.


### Describe the feature you'd like

I hope to publish a translation agent that my customer can use without logging into ragflow.

But the current Begin component in translation agent prevents me from embedding it into a webpage, which means I can not "publish" it.

### Describe implementation you've considered

Maybe add a component can take user input, then the Begin component connects to it and it connects to the generate component in translation

```

issues.title: [Bug]: when stream=falseï¼Œnew message without sessionid does no
issues.body:
### Self Checks

- [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues), including closed ones.
- [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Non-english title submitions will be closed directly ( éè‹±æ–‡æ ‡é¢˜çš„æäº¤å°†ä¼šè¢«ç›´æ¥å…³é—­ ) ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields.

### RAGFlow workspace code commit ID

ec60b32

### RAGFlow image version

 a4f2952 full

### Other environment information

```Markdown

```

### Actual behavior

when stream=false,session_id is not set, as following:
curl --request POST \
     --url http://{address}/api/v1/chats/{chat_id}/completions \
     --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
     --header 'Authorization: Bearer <YOUR_API_KEY>' \
     --data-binary '
     {
          "question": "Who are you",
          "stream": false,
         }'
get event stream response as following:
 {code=0, data=data:{"code": 0, "message": "", "data": {"answer": "Hi! I'm your assistant, what can I do for you?", "reference": {}, "audio_binary": null, "id": null, "session_id": "f3f601ae411f0b5920242ac120006"}}

}


### Expected behavior

get json style response,not event stream.

check the code, the reason is  that:   conversation_service.py 
in case of â€œnot session_idâ€ï¼Œit does not check stream mode, always return event stream response!!!!!!

def completion(tenant_id, chat_id, question, name="New session", session_id=None, stream=True, **kwargs):
    assert name, "`name` can not be empty."
    dia = DialogService.query(id=chat_id, tenant_id=tenant_id, status=StatusEnum.VALID.value)
    assert dia, "You do not own the chat."

     if not session_id:
        session_id = get_uuid()
        conv = {
            "id": session_id,
            "dialog_id": chat_id,
            "name": name,
            "message": [{"role": "assistant", "content": dia[0].prompt_config.get("prologue"), "created_at": time.time()}],
            "user_id": kwargs.get("user_id", "")
        }
        ConversationService.save(**conv)
        yield "data:" + json.dumps({"code": 0, "message": "",
                                    "data": {
                                        "answer": conv["message"][0]["content"],
                                        "reference": {},
                                        "audio_binary": None,
                                        "id": None,
                                        "session_id": session_id
                                    }},
                                   ensure_ascii=False) + "\n\n"
        yield "data:" + json.dumps({"code": 0, "message": "", "data": True}, ensure_ascii=False) + "\n\n"
        return


### Steps to reproduce

```Markdown
curl --request POST \
     --url http://{address}/api/v1/chats/{chat_id}/completions \
     --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
     --header 'Authorization: Bearer <YOUR_API_KEY>' \
     --data-binary '
     {
          "question": "Who are you",
          "stream": false,
         }'

then check the response in command line
```

### Additional information

_No response_
issues.author: bruce-wang518

comments.author: dosubot[bot]
comments.body:
<!-- Answer -->
You're correctâ€”when no session_id is provided, the completion function in conversation_service.py does not check the stream parameter and always returns an event stream response, even if stream=false. This behavior is confirmed in the code and matches what you observed in your cURL t

For deploying an img2txt model for PDF document parsing in RAGFlow, you should select the task that performs image-to-text conversionâ€”typically called "generate" or "image2text" in most multi-modal model APIs. In RAGFlow, the integration expects the model to output text from images,

issues.author: chenly15

comments.author: dosubot[bot]
comments.body:
<!-- Answer -->
The RAGFlow demo at demo.ragflow.io cannot be used as an external knowledge base for difyâ€”API access is not enabled on the demo site, so endpoints like https://demo.ragflow.io/api/v1/retrieval will not work for integration purposes [(source)](https://github.com/orgs/infiniflow/discus

comments.author: KevinHuSh
comments.body: Not supported yet.

### RAGFlow workspace code commit ID

94181a9

### RAGFlow image version

94181a9(v0.18.2)

### Other environment information

```Markdown
Windows Server 2022, no gpu, 32GB ram,
```

### Actual behavior

I'm using ragflow in version v0.18.2 and have created a knowledge base creating embeddings with built-in bge-zh-v1.5 model with auto generation of keywords (5) and questions (2) and graphrag on 70 pdfs. When using a german chat with model llama3.2:3b, which is hosted locally with ollama having activated keywords and graphrag I get the following engleish text within the german answer: 

Chat answer ...

_Musk has consistently expressed his fondness for Dogecoin, often citing its humor and the inclusion of dogs in its branding. He has referred to it as his favorite cryptocurrency. Recently, Musk has hinted at potential future roles for Dogecoin. His tweets have sparked speculation about Dogecoin's potential integration into public services.

 The market is heating up after Elon Musk's announcement about Dogecoin. Is this a new era for crypto?
##7$_

Chat answer continued ......



Could it be that we are facing a run away prompt which has not ended and some how has included parts of the source file prompts.py [see](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/blob/ec60b322abfa0174da8125f46dccaf3da2c939bf/rag/prompts.py#L176) 

Or was the text from the prompts.py exapmle code somehow part of the graphrag database?

### Expected behavior

generate answers only from chunks which are in the knowledge base

### Steps to reproduce

```Markdown
not sure if you are able to reproduce it
```

### Additional information

Maybe you can support me with some commands how we can check that the addadional text from prompts.py is in the graphrag or other componets and how we can delete it from the system.

comments.author: KevinHuSh
comments.body: The 3B LLM is very naive that you can't control its behaviour though prompt well.

issues.body:
### Self Checks

- [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields.

### Describe your problem

Hello, I have two questions regarding RAGflow's functionality:
QA Chunk Embedding
When using the QA chunking mode, does RAGflow support generating embeddings only for the Questions (Q) while excluding the Answers (A)? This could optimize storage and retrieval efficiency for specific use cases.
File Management API
Are there APIs available for performing operations on the File Management module, such as:
Adding new files
Deleting existing files
Generating download links for files
issues.author: cxycxm

comments.author: dosubot[bot]
comments.body:
<!-- Answer -->
RAGflow does not natively support generating embeddings only for Questions (Q) while excluding Answers (A) in QA chunking modeâ€”the system combines both question and answer as a single chunk for embedding. Achieving question-only embeddings would require custom code changes, as thereâ€™

comments.author: cxycxm
comments.body: I haven't found a way to call the File Management API yet, and I can only see that these operations can be done through the web interface.

comments.author: KevinHuSh
comments.body: It's not supported yet in term of FM API.

comments.author: dosubot[bot]
comments.body:
<!-- Answer -->
This error usually means your system is missing the necessary root CA certificates to verify SSL connections. On openEuler, you can often fix this by installing or updating the `ca-certificates` package:

```bash
sudo dnf install ca-certificates
sudo update-ca-trust
```

delimiter setting  of file type  docx markdown and pdf is useless.
Only chunk token size  works .

### Expected behavior

all kinds of file will be chunked using the specified delimiter firse , not just only depend on chunk size.


### Steps to reproduce

```Markdown
upload a docx/markdown file 
settting a specified  delimiter 
start to parse

the chunk content is not not split based on the delimiter, but solely based on the chunk size.
```

### Additional information

I reviewed the implementation code for Markdown, DOCX, and PDF, and none of them use a delimiter to chunk content based on user-specified separators. Only the TXT parser uses a delimiter â€” and unfortunately, even the TXT parser behaves quite differently from similar utility functions in libraries like LangChain and LlamaIndex.

comments.author: Bob123Yang
comments.body:
@dosu 

From the logs I pasted as above, please tell me which IP I can use to login RAGFlow from a remote system with the network connection available to RAGFlow server.

comments.author: dosubot[bot]
comments.body:
<!-- Answer -->
You can use the IP address `172.18.0.6` to log in to RAGFlow from another system. Since RAGFlow is configured to listen on `0.0.0.0` and the HTTP port is set to `9380`, you should be able to access it using the URL `http://172.18.0.6:9380` <sup>[[1]](https://github.com/infiniflow/rag

comments.author: Bob123Yang
dosubot[bot]
comments.body:
<!-- Answer -->
The IP address `172.18.0.6` is likely a Docker internal IP, which is not accessible from external networks. Instead, you should use the server's external IP, `10.103.162.176`, for remote access. Since you can ping `10.103.162.176` but cannot access RAGFlow, the issue might be related

issues.title: [Feature Request]: Return number of used tokens from endpoints that use tokens
issues.body:
### Self Checks

- [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues), including closed ones.
- [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Non-english title submitions will be closed directly ( éè‹±æ–‡æ ‡é¢˜çš„æäº¤å°†ä¼šè¢«ç›´æ¥å…³é—­ ) ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields.

### Is your feature request related to a problem?

```Markdown
I want to track the number of tokens used by the different requests made.
```

### Describe the feature you'd like

Any endpoint that uses up tokens at a 3rd party AI provider should return the number of used tokens for the given action. Such endpoints would be e.g.:

- POST `/api/v1/chats/{chat_id}/completions`
- POST `/api/v1/agents/{agent_id}/completions`
- POST `/api/v1/datasets/{dataset_id}/documents/{document_id}/chunks`

### Describe implementation you've considered

This information is currently not returned by RAGFlow.

### Documentation, adoption, use case

```Markdown
Recording more detailed statistics as just how many tokens where used last month in general.
```

### Additional information

Not sure if it is possible just like that, given that RAGFlow might invoke several different services. I guess it should be a map of services to tokens then.
issues.author: panzi

comments.author: ZhenhangTung
comments.body: Hi @panzi ! I'm the PM of RAGFlow. Could you share why do you want to track the number of tokens? That will help us understand the problem and provide the solution.

comments.author: panzi
comments.body: AI services calculate costs based on tokens. We provide a sort of chatbot integration backed by RAGFlow and OpenAI and other LLMs. If we want to pass on the costs accurately to our customers we need to know how many tokens their invocations have cost. Alternatively getting such stats on a per knowle

The use of 'ï¼Œ' (U+FF0C), the full-width Chinese comma, at line 559 in `deepdoc/parser/resume/step_two.py` is intentional. This character is used as part of a regular expression to handle text normalization and tokenization for multilingual data, especially Chinese resumes, where punc

comments.author: panzi

comments.body:
@panzi Hi. Thanks for pointing this out! You're absolutely right â€” currently, we use the fullwidth comma ï¼Œ (U+FF0C) because our initial user base was primarily Chinese-speaking, and this punctuation is standard in CJK (Chinese, Japanese, Korean) contexts.

However, as the community grows and more us

<!-- Answer -->
The EOF error when posting to http://127.0.0.1:33395/completion is likely due to Docker networking: 127.0.0.1 inside a container refers to the container itself, not the host or other containers. For inter-container communication, use the Docker Compose service name (e.g., ragflow-ser

comments.author: voycey
comments.body: @dosu how do I mark an etnire document as complete? It seems that is where it is failing

comments.author: dosubot[bot]
comments.body:
<!-- Answer -->
To mark an entire document as complete in RAGFlow, you need to update its status using the API. The relevant endpoint is `/change_status`, which requires a POST request with the following JSON payload:

```json
{
  "doc_id": "<YOUR_DOCUMENT_ID>",
  "status": "1"
}
```

Here, `"status

comments.author: dosubot[bot]
comments.body:
<!-- Answer -->
You can update the document status directly in the database or Elasticsearch, bypassing the API.

For the database:  
The document status is stored in the document table as the status field (CharField, "1" = valid/active, "0" = wasted). You can run a SQL query like:
```sql
UPDATE doc

issues.title: [Feature Request]: user_default_llm supports to configure different model factory for each type model
issues.body:
### Self Checks

- [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues), including closed ones.
- [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Non-english title submitions will be closed directly ( éè‹±æ–‡æ ‡é¢˜çš„æäº¤å°†ä¼šè¢«ç›´æ¥å…³é—­ ) ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields.

### Is your feature request related to a problem?

```Markdown
Currently, it seems like the user_default_llm would ONLY support one single model factory to provide multiple models, e.g. QWen to provide both chat model, embedding model, rerank model etc. It would be great if we could support to configure different model factory for each type model.
```

### Describe the feature you'd like

Configure different model factory for each type model in the service config yaml so that the new sign-up users would have these default llm models to use.

### Describe implementation you've considered

like this ?

```
user_default_llm:
   chat_model:
     model: 'qwen-plus'
     factory: 'Tongyi-Qianwen'
     api_key: 'sk-xxxxxxxxxxxxx'
     base_url: 'xxx'
     max_tokens: 65536
  embedding_model:
     model: 'BAAI/bge-large-...'
     factory: 'Tongyi-Qianwen'
     api_key: 'sk-xxxxxxxxxxxxx'
     base_url: 'xxx'
     max_tokens: 65536
  ...
```


### Documentation, adoption, use case

```Markdown

```

### Additional information

_No response_

comments.author: ZhenhangTung
comments.body: @Colstuwjx Thanks for the feedback and will evaluate it later.

issues.title: [Feature Request]: Batch add chunks
issues.body:
### Is there an existing issue for the same feature request?

- [X] I have checked the existing issues.

### Is your feature request related to a problem?

```Markdown
We do our own automated preprocessing of somewhat big data sets. Uploading it all as a single generated XSLX document would be too big. We need to record the relation of chunk IDs to our own database entries anyway, so we can properly update the chunks without re-doing everything.
```


### Describe the feature you'd like

API method to batch add multiple chunks at once.

```Python
Document.add_chunks(chunks: list[str]) -> list[str]
```

The return value are the new chunk IDs, correctly correlated to the chunks as passed as the parameter.

Alternatively including the `important_keywords` parameter and returning `Chunk` objects:

```Python
from typing import TypedDict, NotRequired

class ChunkParams(TypedDict):
    content: str
    important_keywords: NotRequired[str]

Document.add_chunks(chunks: list[ChunkParams]) -> list[Chunk]
```

### Describe implementation you've considered

_No response_

### Documentation, adoption, use case

_No response_

### Additional information

_No response_

issues.body:

x

```

### Actual behavior

This appears similar to issue #8057

# PoC script 
```python
from ragflow_sdk import RAGFlow

rag = RAGFlow("ragflow-E2OThiZWJjNDE0ZDExZjBiOWI3MTZkZm", "http://127.0.0.1:9380")

dataset = rag.create_dataset("test_create_dataset")
blob = b"Sample document content for test."
document_infos = []
document_infos.append({"display_name": "test_1.txt", "blob": blob})

docs = dataset.upload_documents(document_infos)

for doc in docs:
    doc.update({"name": "update.txt"})
    print(doc.name)
```
# result
```
test_1.txt
```

# expected
```
update.txt
```

### Expected behavior

_No response_

### Steps to reproduce

```Markdown
1. Create DataSet instance
2. Create Document instance
2. Call update() with new data
3. Object attributes remain unchanged
```

### Additional information

_No response_
issues.author: asiroliu

comments.author: dosubot[bot]
comments.body:
<!-- Answer -->
The behavior you're seeing is expected based on how the RAGFlow Python SDK is implemented. The Document.update() method updates the document in the database, but it does not automatically refresh the attributes of the in-memory Python object. This is a common pattern with ORMs like p

issues.title: [Question]: How to correctly connect RAGFlow with Open WebUI without HTTP requests?
issues.body:
### Self Checks

- [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues), including closed ones.
- [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Non-english title submitions will be closed directly ( éè‹±æ–‡æ ‡é¢˜çš„æäº¤å°†ä¼šè¢«ç›´æ¥å…³é—­ ) ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields.

### Describe your problem

I am running either RAGFlow and Open WebUI services via docker containers in the same network. This is the connection function I am using to connect to a RAGFlow Agent using Open WebUI:
`  def __init__(self):
        self.type = "pipe"
        self.id = "ragflow_agent_pipe"
        self.name = "RAGFlow Agent Pipe"
        self.valves = self.Valves()
        self.session_id = None

    def pipe(self, body: dict, __user__: dict):
        messages = body.get("messages", [])
        if not messages:
            return "No input provided."

        # Procesamiento de mensajes y contexto (igual que antes)
        history_limit = max(0, int(self.valves.RAGFLOW_HISTORY_LIMIT))
        if history_limit == 0:
            relevant_messages = [messages[-1]]
        else:
            relevant_messages = messages[-min(history_limit + 1, len(messages)) :]

        conversation_context = ""
        for msg in relevant_messages[:-1]:
            role = msg.get("role", "")
            content = msg.get("content", "")
            if role and content:
                conversation_context += f"{role.capitalize()}: {content}\n\n"

        user_question = messages[-1]["content"]
        full_question = (
            f"Conversation history:\n{conversation_context}\nUser's current question: {user_question}"
            if conversation_context
            else user_question
        )

        headers = {
            "Authorization": f"Bearer {self.valves.RAGFLOW_API_KEY}",
            "Content-Type": "application/json",
        }

        # 1. Crear sesiÃ³n
        session_url = f"{self.valves.RAGFLOW_API_BASE_URL}/api/v1/agents/{self.valves.RAGFLOW_AGENT_ID}/sessions"
        session_response = requests.post(session_url, headers=headers, json={})

        if session_response.status_code != 200:
            return f"Error al crear la sesiÃ³n: {session_response.text}"

        session_json = session_response.json()
        session_id = session_json.get("data", {}).get("id")

        ask_url = f"{self.valves.RAGFLOW_API_BASE_URL}/api/v1/agents/{self.valves.RAGFLOW_AGENT_ID}/completions"
        payload = {"question": full_question, "stream": True, "session_id": session_id}
        ask_response = requests.post(
            ask_url, headers=headers, json=payload, stream=True
        )
`


I want to know if there is a possibility to run this without using requests, as I do not want to have access to Internet in my PC when I run this agent.

issues.title: [Bug]: /api/v1/retrieval: dataset_id format (string vs. array) depends on chunk ingestion source (/chunk/create vs. file import)
issues.body:
### Self Checks

- [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues), including closed ones.
- [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Non-english title submitions will be closed directly ( éè‹±æ–‡æ ‡é¢˜çš„æäº¤å°†ä¼šè¢«ç›´æ¥å…³é—­ ) ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields.

### RAGFlow workspace code commit ID

a99739166cf5be0553dcf2e56f39c80b5878e324 

### RAGFlow image version

v0.17.2

### Other environment information

```Markdown

```

### Actual behavior

The /api/v1/retrieval endpoint returns an inconsistent format for the dataset_id field within the chunks array of its response.

When chunks are ingested into RAGFlow via file import, the corresponding dataset_id in the API response is a string (e.g., "xxxxxxxx").
When chunks are created via the /api/v1/chunk/create API endpoint, the corresponding dataset_id in the /api/v1/retrieval API response is an array containing a single string (e.g., ["xxxxxxxx"]). This inconsistency in data type (string vs. array) for the same conceptual field causes deserialization issues in strongly-typed client applications.

### Expected behavior

The dataset_id field in the /api/v1/retrieval API response should have a consistent data format for all chunks, regardless of how they were created or ingested.
Ideally, since dataset_id typically refers to a single dataset to which a chunk belongs, it should consistently be a string. If there's a reason for it to be an array (e.g., a chunk could belong to multiple datasets), then it should always be an array (even if it's an array with a single element or an empty array). The current mixed behavior is problematic.

### Steps to reproduce

```Markdown
Create a Knowledge Base:
Create a new knowledge base (dataset) in the RAGFlow UI. Let's call its ID test_kb_id.
Import a File:
Upload a file into test_kb_id. For example, an Excel file formatted as QA pairs, containing at least one QA pair. This will be parsed into one or more chunks by RAGFlow.
Manually Add a Chunk via UI:
Navigate within the RAGFlow UI to the knowledge base test_kb_id and the document created from the imported file.
Manually add a new chunk to this document through the UI.
Query Elasticsearch:
Directly query Elasticsearch to inspect the chunks created in steps 2 and 3 within the index associated with test_kb_id (e.g., ragflow_test_kb_id or similar). Example query to retrieve some chunks from the relevant index:
Bash

curl -u "elastic:infini_rag_flow" "http://<your_es_host>:<your_es_port>/<index_for_test_kb_id>/_search?pretty&size=10"
Observe kb_id Inconsistency:
In the Elasticsearch results, compare the _source.kb_id field for chunks created by file import (step 2) versus the chunk manually added via the UI (step 3).
It's observed that the kb_id for the file-imported chunk is a string (e.g., "test_kb_id"), while the kb_id for the chunk manually added via the UI is an array containing a single string (e.g., ["test_kb_id"]).
```

### Additional information

This inconsistency in _source.kb_id storage within Elasticsearch (string vs. array) directly leads to the /api/v1/retrieval endpoint returning dataset_id with varying formats. This, in turn, causes deserialization problems for client applications expecting a consistent schema. The OpenAPI specification for /api/v1/retrieval also suggests dataset_id should be a string.
issues.author: openproix

comments.author: dosubot[bot]
comments.body:
<!-- Answer -->
The inconsistency you observed with the dataset_id (or kb_id) format in the /api/v1/retrieval endpointâ€”sometimes being a string and other times an arrayâ€”stems from a recent change in the backend where the identifier was renamed from dataset_ids to kb_id. The backend now expects kb_id

comments.author: openproix
comments.body:
Commit a99739166cf5be0553dcf2e56f39c80b5878e324 (messaged as "Code format.") changed the kb_id assignment from doc.kb_id to [doc.kb_id]. Was this change to store kb_id as an array intentional?

This appears to contribute to inconsistent dataset_id formats (string vs. array) in the /api/v1/retrieval

Small2big can improve the accuracy of recall, and using large slices can also ensure integrity.

```

issues.title: [Question]: Incorrect RAGFlow Chunking: Headings and Tables Split
issues.body:
### Self Checks

- [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues), including closed ones.
- [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Non-english title submitions will be closed directly ( éè‹±æ–‡æ ‡é¢˜çš„æäº¤å°†ä¼šè¢«ç›´æ¥å…³é—­ ) ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields.

### Describe your problem

I'm trying to chunk a Markdown file using RAGFlow. My Markdown has sections, each starting with a ## heading followed by a table. 
## label1

| problem  | reason  | measure  |
| --- | :-: | :-: |
| problem1 | reason1 | measure1 |
| problem2 | reason2 | measure2 |
| problem3 | reason3 | measure3 |

## label2

| problem   |  reason  |  measure  |
| ---- | :--: | :--: |
| problem21 | reason21 | measure21 |
| problem22 | reason22 | measure22 |
| problem23 | reason23 | measure23 |

I've set RAGFlow to split chunks by the ## delimiter, hoping to get each heading and its table together in one chunk.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f2721246-2d94-422b-b53d-1589f55246f2)

However, RAGFlow is currently putting all the headings into one chunk and all the tables into a different chunk (or multiple chunks, one for each table), rather than keeping each heading with its own table. The RAGFlow settings I'm using are shown in this screenshot.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1198409b-387b-49d0-82f0-f4202881dca8)

[@dosu](https://go.dosu.dev/dosubot).

Your configuration changesâ€”removing blank lines and setting the chunk token number to 2â€”did not resolve the issue because of how RAGFlow's Markdown parser currently works. The parser extracts tables and headings as separate entities before chunking, so even with the correct delimiter

issues.title: [Bug]: Delimiter setting not working as intended
issues.body:
### Is there an existing issue for the same bug?

- [x] I have checked the existing issues.

### RAGFlow workspace code commit ID

na

### RAGFlow image version

v0.15.1-180-g036f37a6 full

### Other environment information

```Markdown
docker windows gpu compose file, no changes
```

### Actual behavior

Using mutli-char delimiter is not working as intended. Setting `word` in backticks does not lead to a chunk on that word. A quick glance at the codebase suggests the way the regex is built may not be handling string delimiters properly (treating them as a collection of individual chars instead)

### Expected behavior

text to delimit on a given string match and be visible as chunks 

### Steps to reproduce

```Markdown
create basic collection
use general parser
update the delimiter section to have `word` as sole value
upload text or md document containing the desired delimiter at intervals
process document in ui and view chunks
note they have not delimited on provided word
```

### Additional information

_No response_

issues.title: [Feature Request]:Optimize the current chunk split strategy based on separators and the max token setting.
issues.body:
### Self Checks

- [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues), including closed ones.
- [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Non-english title submitions will be closed directly ( éè‹±æ–‡æ ‡é¢˜çš„æäº¤å°†ä¼šè¢«ç›´æ¥å…³é—­ ) ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields.

### Is your feature request related to a problem?

```Markdown
I feel that the current chunk split logic is counterintuitive and incorrect. 
The current approach first uses multiple separators to split the text into small chunks, and then stitches those small fragments back together until reaching the specified max_token limit.

Under this logic, even if the first separator already produces chunks that meet the max token limit, the system still combines this chunk with subsequent ones. â€” This is highly counterintuitive. If a user sets multiple separators, the expectation is that the first separator will produce chunks that satisfy the token limit. Only when a chunk exceeds the max token limit should the second separator be used to further split it.
```

### Describe the feature you'd like

I believe the correct logic should be: 
If I specify multiple separators, the system should first try splitting using the first separator. 
If the resulting segments are smaller than the max_token value, then each of those should be treated as complete chunks. 
If any segment is larger than max_token, then the next separator should be tried for further splitting. If all separators are exhausted and the resulting segment is still larger than max_token, only then should the last resort be appliedâ€”truncating based on the max_token limit.

### Describe implementation you've considered

_No response_

### Documentation, adoption, use case

```Markdown

```

### Additional information

_No response_
issues.author: sinopec

comments.author: ZhenhangTung
comments.body:
@sinopec Thanks for the thoughtful proposal.

To help us better understand and prioritize this, could you share what specific problems the current chunking logic has caused in your actual use cases? For example, are there particular retrieval failures, performance issues, or quality concerns that th

issues.title: [Feature Request]: Add support for parent-child chunk and chunk overlap functionality.
issues.body:
### Self Checks

- [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues), including closed ones.
- [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Non-english title submitions will be closed directly ( éè‹±æ–‡æ ‡é¢˜çš„æäº¤å°†ä¼šè¢«ç›´æ¥å…³é—­ ) ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields.

### Is your feature request related to a problem?

```Markdown
The current chunk strategy is not effective, especially in scenarios where related content is spread far apart. 
Additionally, the current segmentation does not support overlap between chunks, which leads to severe semantic fragmentation when truncating based on the max token limit.
```

### Describe the feature you'd like

Add support for parent-child chunk, so that when a specific chunk is retrieved, its parent sectionâ€”or even the entire documentâ€”can also be retrieved accordingly.

Add an overlap setting so that when truncation based on the max token limit is unavoidable, a specified number of characters from the previous chunk can be included in the current chunk. This helps prevent semantic fragmentation.

### Describe implementation you've considered

This is a feature that has already been implemented by competitors. As a project dedicated to building knowledge bases, RAGFlow should do this better than other projects that treat knowledge bases as just a minor featureâ€”otherwise, where is RAGFlow's competitive edge?


### Documentation, adoption, use case

```Markdown
[https://docs.dify.ai/en/guides/knowledge-base/create-knowledge-and-upload-documents/chunking-and-cleaning-text](url)
```

### Additional information

_No response_
issues.author: sinopec

comments.author: ZhenhangTung
comments.body:
@sinopec Hi, Iâ€™m the product manager of RAGFlow. Wanna say thanks to your feedback. 

We donâ€™t adopt features solely because competitors have implemented them. For the issue you raised, weâ€™ll evaluate it carefully. Whether and how we address it will be based on internal research and user need priori

### Is your feature request related to a problem?

```Markdown
Hi team,

I've found the db migration would be done by automatically with `init_web_db()` and `init_web_data()`. However, within a more restrict enterprise production environment, it would be hard to grant create table such DDL permissions to the application service, instead, we need to provide all of the raw sqls and complete the audit / review before actually run the migration.

Is it possible to provide all of the migration sqls like langfuse did: https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse/tree/main/packages/shared/prisma/migrations ?
```

### Describe the feature you'd like

Provide the raw migration sqls under an individual folder so that we could do manual migration.

### Describe implementation you've considered

_No response_

```Markdown

```

issues.title: [Feature Request]: Outline KB integration (getoutline.com)
issues.body: ### Is there an existing issue for the same feature request? - [X] I have checked the existing issues. ### Is your feature request related to a problem? ```Markdown Yes. Currently, RAGFlowâ€™s knowledge bases are limited to file uploads, which restricts the ability to integrate dynamic, structured data from external platforms (e.g., Outline, BookStack, Docmost, etc.). This creates friction for users who want to unify their workflows with live or collaboratively updated knowledge bases. ``` ### Describe the feature you'd like Iâ€™d like to suggest RAGFlow support integration with external knowledge bases, starting with platforms like [Outline](https://www.getoutline.com/). This would enable users to connect their external KBs directly to RAGFlow, providing real-time access to structured data for retrieval-augmented generation. ## Key capabilities - Sync structured data (e.g., collections, documents, pages) from external APIs. - Enable real-time updates via webhooks or polling mechanisms. - Allow users to manage and prioritise multiple knowledge base connections within RAGFlow. ### Describe implementation you've considered - API integration: Begin with Outlineâ€™s RPC-style API and OpenAPI specification to fetch and sync content. Extend to other platforms like BookStack and Docmost using their respective APIs. - Incremental Syncs: Implement webhook-based incremental updates or scheduled polling to ensure live data remains accessible. - Data structuring: Map external knowledge base structures (e.g., Collections/Documents in Outline, Books/Pages in BookStack) to RAGFlowâ€™s knowledge base model. - Authentication: Use API keys. ### Documentation, adoption, use case ```Markdown Scenarios: - Dynamic knowledge updates: A team using Outline, Docmost or BookStack to manage evolving documentation can sync their collections/pages with RAGFlow, ensuring generated responses reflect the most current information. - Collaborative KBs: Teams working on shared knowledge bases like Outline, Docmost, BookStack, etc., can integrate directly into RAGFlow for enhanced querying, summarisation, and retrieval. - Hybrid workflows: Organisations combining file-based and live knowledge systems can centralise their workflows by integrating these platforms with RAGFlow. Example Workflow: 1. User connects an external knowledge base (e.g., Outline) by providing API credentials. 2. RAGFlow fetches and indexes the content for retrieval. 3. Subsequent updates in the external platform trigger real-time syncs or periodic updates in RAGFlow. ``` ### Additional information [Outline API Documentation](https://www.getoutline.com/developers) ---

issues.title: [Bug]: Embeddable Chat Iframe Causes Parent Page to Jump When New Messages Appear
issues.body:
### Self Checks

- [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues), including closed ones.
- [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Non-english title submitions will be closed directly ( éè‹±æ–‡æ ‡é¢˜çš„æäº¤å°†ä¼šè¢«ç›´æ¥å…³é—­ ) ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields.

### RAGFlow workspace code commit ID

cb37f00a8fb517d8507dc48a7c017d57ba8828c0

### RAGFlow image version

v0.18.0 slim

### Other environment information

```Markdown

```

### Actual behavior

When embedding the RAGFlow chat interface as an iframe in an external website, the parent page jumps/scrolls to the position of the iframe whenever a new message is added to the chat. This creates a disruptive user experience when the iframe is positioned lower on the page, as users are constantly scrolled away from their current position.

The issue occurs because the chat component uses scrollIntoView() to automatically scroll to new messages, but this method affects the parent page's scrolling as well, not just the content within the iframe.

### Expected behavior

The chat interface should automatically scroll to show new messages, but this scrolling should be contained within the iframe only. The parent page should remain at its current scroll position regardless of activity within the embedded chat.

### Steps to reproduce

```Markdown
Create a chat assistant and share it using the embed feature
Copy the generated iframe code
Create a test HTML page with significant content before the iframe (to ensure scrolling is noticeable)
Embed the iframe in the test page
Load the page and scroll down to see the iframe
Send a message in the chat
Observe how the parent page jumps to bring the iframe into view when the response is received
```

### Additional information

_No response_

A table in a database, such as the user table, can become locked for a long time when a transaction holds a lock and does not release it promptly. This often happens if a transaction is left open (for example, due to a long-running operation, a crash, or a deadlock), or if multiple c

```

### Actual behavior

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f8b3cafc-41c0-4c27-b917-34bcbb05d0e2)

When I update the model selection through the Update chat assistant interface: PUT /api/v1/chats/{chat_id}, and provide llm.model_name=deepseek-r1:32b to the interface, it can be successfully saved. However, the assistant session cannot call the model because the @Ollama field is not added to my model in the above code, resulting in llm_id=deepseek-r1:32b. If I want llm_id to be saved correctly, I need to set llm.model_name=deepseek-r1:32b@Ollama, but this makes it impossible for me to verify through the source code in the above screenshot.

The llm.model_name=deepseek-r1:32b I submitted should be processed by adding the @ suffix, or when verifying the query, the @ suffix should be automatically truncated for the query.

### Steps to reproduce

```Markdown
Submit a modification to the chat assistant through the "Update chat assistant" method by sending a PUT request to /api/v1/chats/{chat_id}, and update and submit the value of llm.model_name
```

### Additional information

_No response_

issues.title: [Bug]: Using os.path.join for api_base and v1 causes incorrect URL on Windows
issues.body:
### Self Checks

- [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues), including closed ones.
- [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Non-english title submitions will be closed directly ( éè‹±æ–‡æ ‡é¢˜çš„æäº¤å°†ä¼šè¢«ç›´æ¥å…³é—­ ) ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields.

### RAGFlow workspace code commit ID

v0.19.0

### RAGFlow image version

v0.19.0

### Other environment information

```Markdown

```

### Actual behavior

When calling the cv_model classes, the api_base is concatenated with 'v1' using `os.path.join()`. On Windows, this results in:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/956f58a4-043b-4b67-950c-19e983b94ee8)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1118aa8c-6fd2-444c-9047-43f26bf9fb38)

However, the expected URL should be: `http://{api_base}/v1`
I think this happens because os.path.join is intended for file system paths and uses backslashes (\) on Windows.

### Expected behavior

The api_base and 'v1' should be joined to form a valid URL using forward slashes (/), regardless of the operating system. 

### Steps to reproduce

```Markdown
On a Windows machine:
1. Deploy the image2txt model on Ragflow.
2. Parse a file, which calls vision_model (located at app/naive.py, line 422).
3. This triggers a call to the cv_model class in llm/cv_model.py.
4. An error occurs due to malformed URL construction when joining api_base and 'v1' using os.path.join.
```

### Additional information

_No response_

The reason OCR is being used when you select the "naive" PDF parser with the "Laws" chunking method is due to how the parser and chunking logic are implemented in RAGFlow. Both the "naive" and "Laws" chunking methods for PDFs rely on a parser class that, by default, performs OCR as p

comments.author: LCHONE
comments.body: @dosu How to disable ocr?

comments.author: dosubot[bot]
comments.body:
<!-- Answer -->
To disable OCR in RAGFlow when parsing PDFs (including with the "naive" parser and "Laws" chunking method), set the parser configuration option layout_recognize to "Plain Text". This forces RAGFlow to use the PlainParser, which extracts text directly from the PDF and skips OCR entire

comments.author: dosubot[bot]
comments.body:
<!-- Answer -->
The language setting does exist in RAGFlow version 0.19. Its main function is to specify the primary language of your knowledge base, which can affect how documents are processed, embedded, and retrieved. By default, the system sets this to "Chinese" if your server environment variab

comments.author: KevinHuSh
comments.body:
We discovered that the language setting for most users were meaningless. The documents in a KB could be in any language.
So, we deprecated it.

issues.title: [Feature Request]: Prioritize multi language first.
issues.body:
### Is there an existing issue for the same feature request?

- [X] I have checked the existing issues.

### Is your feature request related to a problem?

_No response_

### Describe the feature you'd like

As already told, you're doing a great job and really awesome work.
Ragflow to me has high potential and is just a few steps away for use in production (to me).
I use the assistant UI only at the moment as I'd just like to chat casually with indexed documents. It works great - but only a few steps are missing to get the best backend for everyone, which is about multilinguage support. Your OCR/parsing is just a few steps away to detect special "Westen/European" Characters. Another thing is, that the generated questions (not sure about keywords), are sometimes generated in English. A multilanguage model might be able to handle translation and context understanding but I am not sure about the embedding. Multiple stored languages in the vector might kill the accuracy.

It would be great if you could "priorize" these 2 things but we all understand, if you have other plans or priorities which is no problem of course. Thank you so far for your contribution. Keep it up.

### Describe implementation you've considered

_No response_

### Documentation, adoption, use case

_No response_

### Additional information

_No response_

Edit:
If you need support for datasets or training, etc. let me know. I don't know much but I'd like to help somehow. Just let me know.

comments.author: just-wang
comments.body: @dosu How should I set the document parsing language?

comments.author: dosubot[bot]
comments.body:
<!-- Answer -->
RAGFlow sets the document parsing language by using the server's environment variable `LANG`. If "zh_CN" is detected in `os.getenv("LANG", "")`, it defaults to "Chinese"; otherwise, it defaults to "English" <sup>[[1]](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/6889)</sup>. Addition

Your file upload is likely succeeding, but Deepseek is not analyzing the file because the document has not completed the parsing and chunking process required for retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) in RAGFlow. This is a common situation: the upload step only stores the file (typica

comments.author: xiaoweifang2024
comments.body: Got it, I have another question,  I want to send deepseek a whole file, etc a contract, and let deepseek to analyse whether there are risks in the contract. I know that ragflow retrieves by chunks, and only sends the top N chunks  to deepseek. How to ensure the whole file not part of file is sent?@d

comments.author: dosubot[bot]
comments.body:
<!-- Answer -->
RAGFlow does not provide a built-in way to bypass chunking and send an entire file directly to Deepseek. By default, RAGFlow splits documents into chunks (based on token count and delimiters) and only retrieves the top N most relevant chunks for LLM analysis, regardless of the backen

issues.title: [Feature Request]: Support dynamic update of Agent begin component parameters through interface
issues.body:
### Self Checks

- [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues), including closed ones.
- [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Non-english title submitions will be closed directly ( éè‹±æ–‡æ ‡é¢˜çš„æäº¤å°†ä¼šè¢«ç›´æ¥å…³é—­ ) ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields.

### Is your feature request related to a problem?

```Markdown

```

### Describe the feature you'd like

In the process of using RAGflow, I found that when the agent's begin component creates a dialogue through an interface call, the internal parameters cannot be dynamically updated once they are set. Even if the subsequent business logic changes, the original parameters remain unchanged and can only be indirectly implemented by calling the new interface through the invoke component. 

When actually building an agent with multiple steps, some initial parameters may need to be updated based on subsequent user input or external events. For example, if the user modifies the goal or supplements information during the process, or the system needs to dynamically adjust the configuration, the flexibility of the agent will be limited if the parameters of the begin component cannot be updated.

It is hoped that the parameters of the begin component can be dynamically updated during the session lifecycle through an API interface, or related update methods can be provided so that the agent can flexibly adjust its behavior according to changes in business processes or user input.

### Describe implementation you've considered

Provide an API interface for updating begin parameters;
Or allow some mechanism to bind begin component parameters to context variables so that they change with context changes.

### Documentation, adoption, use case

```Markdown

```

### Additional information

_No response_

issues.title: [Question]: How to create a flow that waits for multiple user messages before interacting?
issues.body:
### Self Checks

- [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues), including closed ones.
- [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Non-english title submitions will be closed directly ( éè‹±æ–‡æ ‡é¢˜çš„æäº¤å°†ä¼šè¢«ç›´æ¥å…³é—­ ) ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields.

### Describe your problem

I'm trying to build a flow where the user can send multiple messages before triggering a response from the AI. For example, the user might type a few words (I'd like to <enter>) and press Enter without completing the sentence, or in some scenarios, the agent may only call a tool to do something without needing to respond immediately. Then, once a condition is met (like the user typing "done"), the flow should proceed and generate a response using OpenAI.

I understand that every flow step must eventually lead to an interact, but in my use case, I'd like the flow to pause or loop without forcing an interact immediatelyâ€”so the user can continue sending text freely until the condition is met.

Is there a way to:

Have an interact step that effectively does nothing, just to satisfy the requirement?

Or allow flows to continue without needing to show something to the user each time?

issues.title: [Question]: Running the agent, first conversation returns error message and the next conversation directly return
issues.body:
### Self Checks

- [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues), including closed ones.
- [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Non-english title submitions will be closed directly ( éè‹±æ–‡æ ‡é¢˜çš„æäº¤å°†ä¼šè¢«ç›´æ¥å…³é—­ ) ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields.

### Describe your problem

When running the agent, during the first conversation, if the "invoke" component call times out, it returns the message:  
`ERROR: HTTPConnectionPool(host='172.31.7.174', port=8080): Read timed out. (read timeout=5)`

If you continue the conversation, the second response directly returns:  
`{'content': {'0': "HTTPConnectionPool(host='172.31.7.174', port=8080): Read timed out. (read timeout=5)"}`

And in the third round of conversation, it again returns:  
`ERROR: HTTPConnectionPool(host='172.31.7.174', port=8080): Read timed out. (read timeout=5)`

We tried increasing the invoke timeout to 60 seconds since we're unsure how long the API might take, but this issue can still occur.  
Do you have any suggestions on how to fix this?

Here's what the three conversation steps look like in the image

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/907c3c69-c7e3-4587-8872-1b5dceb63532)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/96935718-abb1-4aa5-896c-91de54a5b2de)
issues.author: chenlanqing

comments.author: dosubot[bot]
comments.body:
<!-- Answer -->
The timeout errors youâ€™re seeing with the "invoke" component indicate that the remote server at `172.31.7.174:8080` is not responding within the specified timeout window. Increasing the timeout to 60 seconds is a good first step, but if the server is overloaded, unresponsive, or ther

comments.author: chenlanqing
comments.body:
What other options do we have here? And are you planning to build in retries for the invoke component down the line? 
@dosu

comments.author: dosubot[bot]
comments.body:
<!-- Answer -->
Currently, there are no documented plans or existing discussions in the RAGFlow repository about adding retries to the "invoke" component. The component only supports a configurable timeout, and if the remote service does not respond within that period, it returns an error without re

comments.author: chenlanqing
dosubot[bot]
comments.body:
<!-- Answer -->
There isnâ€™t currently a built-in mechanism in RAGFlow to prevent errors from components like "invoke" from being passed back to users in follow-up conversations. When a component fails (for example, due to a timeout), the error is returned as the response and stored in the conversati

issues.body:
### Self Checks

- [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues), including closed ones.

### Describe your problem

This chunk token number is 128
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a070f3ce-f46e-4896-af0c-800c47a085d1)
This chunk token number is 500
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ed86418b-3d84-4941-958c-ebfb28c913aa)
However, the chunk number parsed by the General method is all 64
issues.author: Sol-Ghf

comments.author: dosubot[bot]
comments.body:
<!-- Answer -->
The reason the number of chunks remains the same (64) after resolution, even when you change the chunk token number (e.g., from 128 to 500), is likely due to how the "General" slicing method works in RAGFlow. The General method splits the document into segments and then combines adja

comments.author: Sol-Ghf
comments.body: @dosu Chunks smaller than the chunk token number will not be merged after splitting?

comments.author: dosubot[bot]
comments.body:
<!-- Answer -->
Yes, in RAGFlow's "General" slicing method, chunks (segments) smaller than the chunk token number will be merged with adjacent segments until the combined token count exceeds the threshold you set. This means that short segments are not left aloneâ€”they are combined to form larger chu

issues.title: [Bug]: the wrong use of task_limiter cause parse stuck when enable graphrag
issues.body:
### Self Checks

- [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues), including closed ones.
- [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Non-english title submitions will be closed directly ( éè‹±æ–‡æ ‡é¢˜çš„æäº¤å°†ä¼šè¢«ç›´æ¥å…³é—­ ) ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields.

### RAGFlow workspace code commit ID

latest

### RAGFlow image version

0.19.0-slim

### Other environment information

```Markdown
CPU:Intel(R) Xeon(R) Silver 4316 CPU @ 2.30GHz
MEM:128GB
OS:Ubuntu 22.04-server

set WORKERS = 4 in entrypoint.sh to start 4 task_executor.
```

### Actual behavior

in task_executor.py  do_handle_task ,when task_type is graphrag, the task_limiter will be replaced with a new one.
```python
        global task_limiter
        task_limiter = trio.CapacityLimiter(2)
```

this is the wrong use of trio  CapacityLimiter, and will cause capacity limit outof control.
this can be verified in the follow code
```python
import trio

MAX_CONCURRENT_TASKS = 5
task_limiter = trio.CapacityLimiter(MAX_CONCURRENT_TASKS)

# æ¨¡æ‹Ÿä»»åŠ¡å‡½æ•°
async def long_task(n):
    global task_limiter
    async with task_limiter:
        print(f"[{n}] Got token, running...")
        if n % 5 == 0 :
            task_limiter = trio.CapacityLimiter(2)
            #task_limiter.total_tokens = 2

        await trio.sleep(20 * 60)  
        print(f"[{n}] Task completed.")

async def task_generator():
    task_id = 1
    while True:
        task_id += 1
        print(f"[{task_id}] Spawning new task...")
        trio.lowlevel.spawn_system_task(long_task, task_id)
        await trio.sleep(1)  


if __name__ == "__main__":
    trio.run(task_generator)

```

the task will be handlled endless untile crash.



### Expected behavior

if we want to  set the capacity dynamicly  ,we shou use 
```python
task_limiter.total_tokens = 2
```

but this is still not the right way to control graphrag task count .I think we should do it  in two ways:
1. control the graphrag task generate speed â€”â€” only when graphrag task count is lower than specific count .
2. use a different redis queue,  special use for graphrag task ,and a unique task_limiter for graphrag. So we dont need to change de task_limiter,and graphrag will not block normal chunk build task.

### Steps to reproduce

```Markdown
enable graphrag , parse 1k docs in the same time .
```

### Additional information

_No response_

comments.body:
<!-- Answer -->
You are correct in identifying that replacing the global `task_limiter` with a new `trio.CapacityLimiter` instance inside the task handler (especially for `graphrag` tasks) can lead to capacity control issues and unpredictable concurrency behavior. This approach breaks the intended c

comments.body:
#7873  kg_limiter  can prevent the generation of unlimited tasks, but graphrag tasks still consume the capacity of the regular task_limiter, which may block normal chunk tasks.

Therefore, a better approach is to use separate Redis queues for graphrag, raptor, and regular chunk tasks. This way, diff

comments.author: yongtenglei
comments.body:
Hi, @GXKIM 

It's intended. For tasks like **summary**, we usually pass in document_ids to ensure all related documents are included, as this generally improves performance. If this is a major concern for you, [here](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/blob/20ab6aad4ab73b6843bc3b79e07c87f3a16fd771

comments.author: yongtenglei
comments.body: Hi, @GXKIM, see [here](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/blob/20ab6aad4ab73b6843bc3b79e07c87f3a16fd771/rag/nlp/search.py#L388). Once document_ids are set, similarity_threshold will default to 0. If this matters to you, delete line 389.

issues.title: [Question]: Is the workflow of the agent parallel?
issues.body:
### Self Checks

- [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues), including closed ones.
- [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Non-english title submitions will be closed directly ( éè‹±æ–‡æ ‡é¢˜çš„æäº¤å°†ä¼šè¢«ç›´æ¥å…³é—­ ) ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields.

### Describe your problem

Is the workflow of the agent parallel?
For example, if a parent node A connects to two child nodes B and C, and node D integrates the outputs of nodes B and C, are nodes B and C computed in parallel, or is B executed first, followed by C?

comments.author: dosubot[bot]
comments.body:
<!-- Answer -->
Based on the available information, the agent workflow in RAGFlow does not appear to execute nodes in parallel. The core execution logic, managed by the Canvas class in agent/canvas.py, prepares and runs components by iterating over them, checking dependencies, and managing execution

comments.body: @dosubot

comments.author: zhugh2333
comments.body: @dosubot

comments.author: dosubot[bot]
comments.body:
<!-- Answer -->
Elasticsearch is used as the default database in RAGFlow because it provides robust support for both full-text and vector search, which are essential for deep document understanding. It offers advanced features like bm25 scoring, phrase and sloppy queries, dynamic query pruning, and

issues.author: dust1or2

comments.author: dosubot[bot]
comments.body:
<!-- Answer -->
The error occurs because the RAGFlow API expects the parameter dataset_ids to be an array (list of strings), not a single string or null value. This is required for endpoints like /api/v1/retrieval and for SDK methods such as create_chat. For example, the correct format in your reque

- **Slim edition**: `infiniflow/ragflow:v0.19.0-slim` (does not include embedding models)

```Markdown
Hi team,

I've found there is a [helm](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/tree/main/helm) folder, however, it's not supported to do some customizations based on the end users requirement, for example, like [higress did](https://github.com/alibaba/higress/blob/main/helm/core/templates/service.yaml#L13), it would be great if we could support to define the service annotation / port mapping.

Otherwise it would need additional effort from end users to install it for production use.

A more user-friendly installation document is also necessary to new customers, otherwise it would be hard to try out this solution in the end users' internal environment.
```

### Additional information

And also, ragflow couldn't be installed in Mac M1 Pro since it has an [issue](https://github.com/infiniflow/infinity/issues/1720) in infinity, which also makes it inconvenient to do the feature testing.

issues.title: [Feature Request]: use different redis queue and task_limiter for different tasks
issues.body:
### Self Checks

- [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues), including closed ones.
- [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Non-english title submitions will be closed directly ( éè‹±æ–‡æ ‡é¢˜çš„æäº¤å°†ä¼šè¢«ç›´æ¥å…³é—­ ) ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields.

### Is your feature request related to a problem?

```Markdown
graphrag task block normal chunk task.
```

### Describe the feature you'd like

There are currently three different types of tasks: chunk, raptor, and graphrag. Each takes a different amount of time to complete and they have dependency relationships in sequence. However, all three types of tasks are currently passed through the same Redis queue and share the same task_limiter for concurrency control.

Because graphrag tasks are particularly time-consuming and cannot be executed concurrently within the same knowledge base (KB), the current approach is to reduce the task limiter's capacity when a graphrag task is received, in order to restrict the number of concurrent tasks.

However, this approach has two problems:
1.Existing tasks cannot be canceled. In actual tests, even with a single worker, there are still 5 graphrag tasks waiting in the queue.
2.graphrag tasks occupy all the available task slots, preventing new, lightweight chunk tasks from being executed â€” even though they are not time-consuming.



### Describe implementation you've considered

Separate the graphrag  , raptor and chunk tasks into different Redis queues, and use different task_limiter instances to control them independently.










### Documentation, adoption, use case

```Markdown

```

### Additional information

_No response_

comments.author: ZhenhangTung

issues.title: [Feature Request]: Use specialized graph databases such as Neo4j to manage and store knowledge graphs and related content.
issues.body:
### Self Checks

- [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues), including closed ones.
- [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Non-english title submitions will be closed directly ( éè‹±æ–‡æ ‡é¢˜çš„æäº¤å°†ä¼šè¢«ç›´æ¥å…³é—­ ) ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields.

### Is your feature request related to a problem?

```Markdown
The current knowledge graph parsing and merging process is slow and not file-parallelized. The locking granularity is at the entire knowledge base level. When parsing a knowledge graph for a single file and merging it into the knowledge base, the whole knowledge base must be locked, which severely affects the processing speed of GraphRAG. A large number of pending GraphRAG tasks block other tasks, such as chunk processing, from getting execution opportunities.
```

### Describe the feature you'd like

Use specialized graph databases like Neo4j instead of Elasticsearch to manage knowledge graphs, improving speed and parallelism while minimizing the use of Redis locks that lock the entire knowledge base.

### Describe implementation you've considered

Leverage features provided by graph databases like Neo4j, such as CREATE, MERGE, and transaction commits, to delegate concurrency control and locking overhead to the database itself. This approach aims to maximize file-level parallelism during parsing, improve parsing speed, and avoid global locks as much as possible. At the same time, it helps reduce the read/write load on the Elasticsearch database.

### Documentation, adoption, use case

```Markdown

```

### Additional information

_No response_
issues.author: sinopec

comments.author: nevergone123

comments.author: Woody-Hu
comments.body:
the chunk id is from
`       d["id"] = xxhash.xxh64((chunk["content_with_weight"] + str(d["doc_id"])).encode("utf-8")).hexdigest() `
which means the same "content_with_weight" will lead the same chunk id (the same chunk)

issues.title: [Question]: How to share the model configuration? Is there an API for joining the team?
issues.body:
### Self Checks

- [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues), including closed ones.
- [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Non-english title submitions will be closed directly ( éè‹±æ–‡æ ‡é¢˜çš„æäº¤å°†ä¼šè¢«ç›´æ¥å…³é—­ ) ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields.

### Describe your problem

Sceneï¼šI have an administrator account in ragflow, such as admin. I configured the model, knowledge base and agent on admin. Then I registered a new account user1 through the api. Then I want the user1 account to join the admin team through the api. And it can share the model, knowledge base and agent configured by admin, and user1 can also establish its own knowledge base and agent.

Q1ï¼šAfter I registered user1 through the api, how can I join the admin team via the api?
Q2ï¼šNow that I manually invite members to join the team, the configuration is not shared. Can the model configuration be shared? Or rather, what should I do? Modify the source code and start it in the form of source code? Are there any other configurations?
issues.author: ztq-max

comments.author: dosubot[bot]
comments.body:
<!-- Answer -->
In RAGFlow, sharing model provider configurations between team members is only possible in the Enterprise version. The free version requires each team member to configure model provider settings individually <sup>[[1]](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/7027)</sup>. 

Regar

comments.author: KevinHuSh
comments.body:
LLM sharing is a feature  of our enterprise version.
No API for team joinning yet.
