issues.body: ### Self Checks - [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues), including closed ones. - [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)). - [x] Non-english title submitions will be closed directly ( éè‹±æ–‡æ ‡é¢˜çš„æäº¤å°†ä¼šè¢«ç›´æ¥å…³é—­ ) ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)). - [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields. ### RAGFlow workspace code commit ID 94181a99 ### RAGFlow image version v0.18.0 ### Other environment information ```Markdown ``` ### Actual behavior After upgrading to RAGFlow v0.18.0, when a knowledge base contains table-parsed data and query results are returned in tabular format, the system consistently returns the same table data in response to all subsequent queries. The issue can only be resolved by deleting knowledge base references containing tables. ### Expected behavior _No response_ ### Steps to reproduce ```Markdown 1ã€create a knowledge base first and upload a excel file 2ã€create a chat assistant and attach the knowledge base 3ã€ask a question about the content of the excel file and return a table format data 4ã€repeat serval times ``` ### Additional information _No response_
issues.author: carl1321

comments.author: KevinHuSh
comments.body: `Table` method is used for data dumped from database. The user's question will be transfered to SQL to search the data.

comments.author: carl1321
comments.body:
> `Table` method is used for data dumped from database. The user's question will be transfered to SQL to search the data.

will it be fixed in the future? The LLM needs to analyze the question first before deciding whether to convert it.

RAGFlow's parser is designed to handle PDF files containing both text and tables using a combination of OCR (Optical Character Recognition), TSR (Table Structure Recognition), and DLR (Document Layout Recognition) tasks. You can select the appropriate visual model for your use case,

issues.body:

### Is your feature request related to a problem?

```Markdown
Currently, ragflow relies on independent file uploads to parse documents. However, many people within enterprises are already accustomed to uploading knowledge to internal wiki websites. Therefore, document administrators must either save web pages as files and re-upload them, or request that authors provide docx files. This makes the process very inconvenient.

issues.title: [Question]: why replace task_limiter with limit of 2 while encounter task type graphrag
issues.body:
### Self Checks

- [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues), including closed ones.
- [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Non-english title submitions will be closed directly ( éè‹±æ–‡æ ‡é¢˜çš„æäº¤å°†ä¼šè¢«ç›´æ¥å…³é—­ ) ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields.

### Describe your problem

in task_executor.py  The default task_limit is 5 got from env.
But why we replace the value to a fixed 2 while recv a graphrag task, and never restored again ?
Dose this means when a graphrag task is recved ,all kinds of task is limited to a fixed number of 2? And why set to a fixed number ?  And it will never go back to the default task limit ( 5)?
```python

MAX_CONCURRENT_TASKS = int(os.environ.get('MAX_CONCURRENT_TASKS', "5"))
MAX_CONCURRENT_CHUNK_BUILDERS = int(os.environ.get('MAX_CONCURRENT_CHUNK_BUILDERS', "1"))
MAX_CONCURRENT_MINIO = int(os.environ.get('MAX_CONCURRENT_MINIO', '10'))
task_limiter = trio.CapacityLimiter(MAX_CONCURRENT_TASKS)


async def do_handle_task(task):
    ...
    # Either using graphrag or Standard chunking methods
    elif task.get("task_type", "") == "graphrag":
        global task_limiter
        task_limiter = trio.CapacityLimiter(2)
```
issues.author: sinopec

issues.title: [Bug]: Potential Issue in `naive_merge_docx` Function
issues.body:
### Self Checks

- [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues), including closed ones.
- [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Non-english title submitions will be closed directly ( éè‹±æ–‡æ ‡é¢˜çš„æäº¤å°†ä¼šè¢«ç›´æ¥å…³é—­ ) ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields.

### RAGFlow workspace code commit ID

none

### RAGFlow image version

none

### Other environment information

```Markdown
### Environment
- File: `rag/nlp/__init__.py`
- Function: `naive_merge_docx`
- Default chunk_token_num: 128
```

### Actual behavior

**Description**
There appears to be a logical issue in the `naive_merge_docx` function in `rag/nlp/__init__.py`. The function initializes `tk_nums = [0]` and uses `tk_nums[-1] > chunk_token_num` as a condition for creating new chunks. This can lead to unexpected behavior when processing the first section of a document.

**Current** Behavior
1. When processing the first section, `tk_nums[-1]` is always 0
2. Since 0 < chunk_token_num (default 128), the first section is always added to the first chunk
3. This can result in the first chunk being larger than intended, as there's no proper size control for the initial chunk

**Code** Location
```python
def naive_merge_docx(sections, chunk_token_num=128, delimiter="\nã€‚ï¼›ï¼ï¼Ÿ"):
    if not sections:
        return [], []

    cks = [""]
    images = [None]
    tk_nums = [0]  # Initialized with 0

    def add_chunk(t, image, pos=""):
        nonlocal cks, tk_nums, delimiter
        tnum = num_tokens_from_string(t)
        if tnum < 8:
            pos = ""
        if tk_nums[-1] > chunk_token_num:  # This condition is always false for the first section
            # ... rest of the code
```

### Expected behavior

The function should properly control chunk sizes from the very beginning, ensuring that:
1. The first chunk follows the same size constraints as subsequent chunks
2. Each chunk's size is properly limited by chunk_token_num
3. The initial empty chunk should be handled appropriately

Add a check for empty chunks to ensure proper chunk size control from the beginning:
```python
if cks[-1] == "" or tk_nums[-1] > chunk_token_num:
    # Create new chunk
```

### Steps to reproduce

```Markdown
none
```

### Additional information

This bug could affect:
1. Document chunking accuracy
2. Memory usage
3. Processing efficiency
4. Quality of downstream tasks that depend on properly sized chunks
issues.author: mateng-matt

comments.author: dosubot[bot]
comments.body:
<!-- Answer -->
Your analysis of the `naive_merge_docx` function is correct. The function initializes `tk_nums` with `[0]` and uses `tk_nums[-1] > chunk_token_num` to determine when to create a new chunk. This means the first section is always added to the first chunk, regardless of its size, which

issues.title: [Question]: Unable to Re-parse Failed Documents via Python API
issues.body:
### Self Checks

- [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues), including closed ones.
- [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).

- [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields.

### Describe your problem

I'm currently using the RAGFlow Python API to build a workflow for batch uploading and parsing documents. The upload and parsing processes generally work fine, but I've consistently encountered an issue where some documents fail to parse. These failed documents are scattered among successfully parsed ones.

I was able to retrieve the documents marked with a `FAIL` status using the relevant API. However, I havenâ€™t been able to find any method that allows me to re-parse these failed documents via the APIâ€”similar to the "Re-parse" button available in the UI.

Hereâ€™s what Iâ€™ve tried so far:

- I attempted to use `async_parse_documents` with the IDs of the failed documents, but I received the following error:
  ```
  Can't stop parsing document with progress at 0 or 1
  ```
- I found a related issue suggesting that the document might need to be canceled first, so I called `async_cancel_parse_documents`, but I got the same error message.
- I then inspected the `progress` value of the failed documents and noticed it was `-1.0`.

At this point, I havenâ€™t been able to identify any API endpoint or documented approach that allows me to re-parse failed documents programmatically. Specifically:
- There doesn't seem to be a method under the **"FILE MANAGEMENT WITHIN DATASET"** section that handles this.
- I also couldnâ€™t find a way to reset the documentâ€™s `progress` or parsing status to make it eligible for reprocessing.

### Request

Could you clarify:
- Is there an official way to re-parse failed documents via the Python API?
- If not, could this functionality be added to align with whatâ€™s available in the UI?

Thanks in advance for your support!

---

### RAGFlow image version

v0.16.0 full

issues.title: [Question]: 0.19 raptor error report
issues.body:
### Self Checks

- [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues), including closed ones.
- [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Non-english title submitions will be closed directly ( éè‹±æ–‡æ ‡é¢˜çš„æäº¤å°†ä¼šè¢«ç›´æ¥å…³é—­ ) ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields.

### Describe your problem

We noticed some issues with the task request order in version 0.19 after enabling the raptor strategy, which caused previous problem-solving methods to become ineffective, such as https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/7442 and https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5942. These issues primarily arise because raptor and graph have high requirements for the concurrent capabilities of LLMs. The previous solution was to modify MAX_CONCURRENT_CHATS=2, meaning the CHATS Number during raptor runtime = raptor number * MAX_CONCURRENT_CHATS, thereby reducing concurrency demands by lowering the MAX_CONCURRENT_CHATS value. The specific reason for the problem in 0.19 is that in version 0.18, if n documents were parsed (paper number=n), the number of articles entering raptor was m (raptor number=m). When processing a large number of articles, the raptor number in 0.18's processing method was rolling, meaning raptor tasks were processed concurrently while other articles were undergoing OCR, thereby reducing the raptor number. By controlling CPU cores or limiting GPU allocation, the raptor number was ensured to remain within a reasonable range, preventing rate limit errors. However, 0.19's processing method leads to an actual raptor number = paper number, which is much larger than the dynamic raptor number in 0.18, consequently causing the MAX_CONCURRENT_CHATS=2 method to fail.
issues.author: vickyyd

comments.author: dosubot[bot]
comments.body:
<!-- Answer -->
In version 0.19, the raptor strategy changed from a dynamic, rolling processing model (used in 0.18) to a batch processing model. In 0.18, documents were processed by raptor as they finished embedding, allowing concurrency to be managed dynamicallyâ€”this kept the number of concurrent

### Actual behavior

the parse progress of all doc is freezed.

observe the whole progess:

1. ,mostly chunk will be done ( but seems the task will be receivd again? or it will be received/executed by multi task_executoer?):
```json

2. grpahrap will not start for a longlong time:
```json
16:26:46 created task graphrag
```
it just show graphrag task is created and nothing else.

3.i checked the server log  and it reports the task heartbeat ;

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a0236093-ae9d-4054-b6d8-5b81df24814c)

I also reviewed the code, and I have two questions:

Will tasks sent through Redis be received multiple times by one task executor ? Can they be received by different task executors

- During the execution of run_graphrag, RedisDistributedLock is used. Its mechanism involves deleting the key before acquiring it, which I donâ€™t quite understand â€” how does this prevent others from accessing the lock at the same time? Is it that only the current process can delete the lock? Iâ€™d like an explanation of how RedisDistributedLock is able to provide protection during the execution of graphrag.
- During the execution of graphrag.run, if an exception occurs midway, could it result in the task_limiter not being released, eventually reaching its limit and preventing any further tasks from being processed?
- The global task_limiter (default 5) is reset to 2 when a task of type graphrag is received. What is the intention behind this design? What problem is it trying to solve or avoid? Could this approach potentially lead to all tasks getting stuck in the end?


### Expected behavior

parse one by one ,slow is acceptable but stuck is not .

### Steps to reproduce

```Markdown

upload 1k docs, and all start parse.
```
